intro: Onosma polyphylla, commonly known as the many-leaved onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Onosma polyphylla is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
